timeline.bodyText: Does the client.index() API call fail for ES 7?
timeline.author: martint

replies.bodyText:
yes.. in version 7 al documents are of doc type and is unnecessary to pass
this fails: new IndexRequest(index, "doc")
replies.author: eskabetxe

replies.bodyText: the dependency check fails at this is used and not provided
replies.author: eskabetxe

replies.bodyText: Ah, that's because TestElasticsearchIntegrationSmokeTest is importing org.testcontainers.shaded.com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. See my comment below.
replies.author: martint

replies.bodyText:
as I have to add
<dependency> <groupId>org.testcontainers</groupId> <artifactId>testcontainers</artifactId> <scope>test</scope> </dependency>
and in presto-root testcontainvers have 1.12.4 version this fails
replies.author: eskabetxe

replies.bodyText: reverted this, rebasing has fix this problem
replies.author: eskabetxe

timeline.bodyText: Why are we assigning a docId to documents? this was previously unnecessary?
timeline.author: martint

replies.bodyText:
high level api generates a random id..
all documents have an _id field, this is that as in low level api we have to provided it.. is generated automatic but we have to put it on url
replies.author: eskabetxe

timeline.bodyText: Don't import the ObjectMapper from the shaded version of jackson inside testcontainers. Add a dependency for jackson to the module, instead.
timeline.author: martint

replies.bodyText:
I dont know why is importing that, jackson is a dependency of this module
fixed
replies.author: eskabetxe

timeline.author: martint
